content.webTitle: Tottenham v Sheffield United: match preview

fields.headline: Tottenham v Sheffield United: match preview
fields.bodyText: On the back of a convincing Champions League win in midweek, Tottenham would normally view the visit of a promoted team as a home banker. Spurs might have beaten Red Star Belgrade on Wednesday but they have not won consecutive games since April, their league results have been poor and Sheffield United, unbeaten away from home this season, arrive as the form team. Would something for the Blades even count as a shock?. David Hytner Saturday 3pm Venue Tottenham Hotspur Stadium Last season n/a Referee Graham Scott This season G6 Y15 R3 3 cards/game Odds H 4-7 A 5-1 D 3-1 TOTTENHAM Subs from Vorm, Walker-Peters, Rose, Sessegnon, Foyth, Dier, Sissoko, Wanyama, Skipp, Lo Celso, Lucas, Parrott Doubtful None Injured Lamela (hamstring, 23 Nov), Vertonghen (hamstring, 23 Nov), Lloris (elbow, Feb) Suspended None Discipline Y24 R1 Form LWLDLD Leading scorer Kane 6 SHEFFIELD UNITED Subs from Moore, Jagielka, Besic, Osborn, Freeman, Sharp, Stearman, McBurnie, Robinson, Verrips Doubtful Egan (knock) Injured None Suspended None Discipline Y20 R1 Form WLDWDW Leading scorers Lundstram, Mousset 3
